subtitle: An easy all-in-one meal - just serve with some warm crusty bread.

method.text: Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add onion and garlic. Fry for 2-3 min until softened. Add pork and mushrooms to pan. Fry for 8-10 min until well browned.
Add tomatoes and tomato puree. Stir in the cider and seasoning. Bring to the boil and simmer for 30 min.
Meanwhile place carrots and beans in a pan of boiling water. Simmer for 8-10 min until tender.
Sift the flour, seasoning, baking powder and mustard together in a bowl. Rub in the butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs.

Stir in the watercress. Add enough milk to bind to a soft and smooth but not sticky dough. Roll out on a lightly floured surface to 5mm thick. Using a 5 cm round cutter, cut out enough rounds to top the casserole.
Drain the carrots and beans thoroughly. Add to the pork mixture. Spoon into an ovenproof dish. Arrange the scone rounds around the edge.
Brush with the beaten egg. Place in the oven for 10-15 min until well risen and golden brown. Serve immediately.

title: Pork casserole with watercress scone topping
